subject: Re: [junit] How to test a bussiness method returns a enumeration
msgSnippet: ... You can test that the Collection contains elements or that the Enumeration is not empty. assert(enumeration.hasMoreElements());
messageBody:
Pendyala Lakshmana wrote:
>
> We are trying to use Junit for unit testing of ejbs. If the business
> methods return any Object like a collection (Enumeration)object, how to test
> them using assertXXX() method.

You can test that the Collection contains elements or that the Enumeration is
not empty.

assert(enumeration.hasMoreElements());
assert(!collection.isEmpty()); //or if you expect it to be empty
assert(collection.isEmpty());

You can test the value of each element of the Collection or Enumeration.

//loop over enumeration
SomeClass sc = (SomeClass) enumeration.nextElement();
assertEquals(some_value, sc.getSomeValue());
